title: NASA, Department of Agriculture Advance Exploration, Science
summary: NASA and the USDA (U.S. Department of Agriculture) signed a memorandum of understanding Wednesday strengthening the collaboration between the two agencies, including efforts to improve agricultural and Earth science research, technology, agricultural management, and the application of science data and models to agricultural decision making.

title: Mynaric to supply laser communications for Raytheon’s missile-tracking satellites
summary: Mynaric will supply laser communications terminals for seven military satellites made by Raytheon Technologies, the company announced June 21.

title: Intelsat walks away from SES merger talks
summary: Intelsat has ended talks about merging with rival satellite operator SES, a source close to the discussions confirmed.

title: NASA Invites Media to Northrop Grumman Cargo Launch to Space Station
summary: Media accreditation is open for launch of the next commercial resupply services mission to deliver NASA science investigations, supplies, and equipment to the International Space Station.

title: NASA Welcomes Ecuador as 26th Artemis Accords Signatory
summary: During a ceremony at the Ecuador embassy in Washington on Wednesday, Ecuador became the 26th country to sign the Artemis Accords. Karen Feldstein, NASA associate administrator for International and Interagency Relations, participated in the signing ceremony for the agency, and Gustavo Manrique Miranda, Ecuador’s foreign affairs minister, signed on

title: NASA Holds Ribbon Cutting for New Earth Information Center
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson led a ribbon cutting ceremony Wednesday to showcase a new Earth Information Center at NASA Headquarters in Washington. The center is part physical space and part virtual experience, which shows how NASA data can improve lives in the face of disasters, environmental challenges, and our changing world.

title: Scout Space announces new investors
summary: Scout Space, a startup developing technologies for space situational awareness, announced June 20 it has secured undisclosed funding from the venture capital firm Decisive Point and from government contractor Noblis.

title: Startup Danti unveils search engine for geospatial data
summary: A new startup, Danti, came out of stealth June 21 with a search engine designed for users of geospatial data.

title: The Space Race may already be won
summary: Justin Fauntleroy is a government contractor responsible for writing future concepts and doctrine for the U.S. military, specifically the Joint Staff and Naval Warfare Development Center. He earned a bachelor’s […]

title: Space Forge names manager for U.S. manufacturing operations
summary: Space Forge will flesh out its U.S. strategy with the help of Andrew Parlock, the U.K.-based startup’s new managing director for U.S. manufacturing operations.
